summary:
Kraków is Poland's second-largest city, known for its rich history and beautiful architecture. It was once the capital of Poland and has been an important cultural center for centuries. The Old Town, with its medieval market square and historic buildings like Wawel Castle and St. Mary's Basilica, is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

The city has a long past, dating back to a trading center in 985. It played a vital role during World War II and is home to many significant institutions, including Jagiellonian University, one of the world's oldest universities. Kraków is also a global city with a busy international airport.
title: Kraków
